messages.subject: Re: Bush On Schools (get out the airline barf bags!)
messages.msgSnippet: ... and if you ... supporting ... he has ... homeschooling laws. ... What saints all these politicians are (LOL)... By rights we all out to be Libertarians as
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com, Cararmst@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 9/3/2000 6:23:14 PM Central Daylight Time,
> lurine@s... writes:
>
> > Weelllll, IMHO, this is a prison sentence without a trial! Oh,
and if you
> > read the article, that evil, the NEA, that supposedly is only
supporting
> > Gore is out in full force behind Dubya and the KIPP idea!
>
> You know, I live in Texas and I've never heard of this KIPP thing.
>
> I do know that Bush is considered a proponent of homeschooling, and
he has
> never done anything in Texas to tamper with our liberal
homeschooling laws.
>
> Carron
What saints all these politicians are (LOL)... By rights we all out
to be Libertarians as they are only party that believes in
homeschooling/unschooling letting parents take care of their kids
education without intervention from the goverment.

Hope this hasn't started another flame war on politics because if it
does I'm out this time... I'll just watch (LOL)

Dawn F
Tucson

messages.subject: Re: Bush On Schools
messages.msgSnippet: From what I ve seen on the Bush net page he is not in favor of putting any restrictions on the homeschooler.  I think KIPP is an idea he s considering for ps.
messages.messageBody:
From what I've seen on the Bush net page he is not in favor of
putting any restrictions on the homeschooler. I think KIPP is an
idea he's considering for ps. You have to admit there's a lot of
room for improvement in ps for those who can not or do not wish to
homeschool. In fact in Tampa, FL area his campaign has a homeschool
mom who acts as a coordinator contact for homeschool.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Bush On Schools (get out the airline barf bags!)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/3/2000 6:23:14 PM Central Daylight Time, ... You know, I live in Texas and I ve never heard of this KIPP thing. I do know that Bush is
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/3/2000 6:23:14 PM Central Daylight Time,
lurine@... writes:

> Weelllll, IMHO, this is a prison sentence without a trial! Oh, and if you
> read the article, that evil, the NEA, that supposedly is only supporting
> Gore is out in full force behind Dubya and the KIPP idea!

You know, I live in Texas and I've never heard of this KIPP thing.

I do know that Bush is considered a proponent of homeschooling, and he has
never done anything in Texas to tamper with our liberal homeschooling laws.

Carron

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Bush On Schools (get out the airline barf bags!)
messages.msgSnippet: Nance, There is a group getting together to push the other parties forward for the next election as it is obvious that a vote for them this year would only
messages.messageBody:
Nance,

There is a group getting together to push the other parties forward for the
next election as it is obvious that a vote for them this year would only
assist Dubya in his goal of becoming all powerful dictator. If a power
base is started now instead of waiting for the next election then we, the
independent thinks will have a chance of actually winning an election.
Unfortunately these parties (Libertarian, Green, etc.) always wait until
the last moment!

Lynda

----------

the

to

>

of

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Bush On Schools (get out the airline barf bags!)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/03/2000 11:23:18 PM !!!First Boot!!!, lurine@softcom.net writes:  ... I was
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/03/2000 11:23:18 PM !!!First Boot!!!,
lurine@... writes:

<<
http://www.insightmag.com/archive/200009184.shtml

<snip>
>>


I was taken by how impressed everyone in the article is that X% "passed" the
TAAS. This is not a particularly demanding test, and all the focus seems to
be on how many kids can pass it. Not do well on it. Just pass.

So we are going to spend lots and lots of hours aiming at the lower half of
the class and making sure everyone can pass a meaningless test.

Oh goodie.

Now, where was that web page about the Independent Party. They may lose but
at least I don't have to hear this particular brand of hogwash.

Nance
